page.title: 01Douglas Water
page.content: The village of Douglas Water lies in the valley of the stream of the same. The farms on the lower slopes of the valley are mainly dairy farms,although some are rearing cattle for beef. The crops grown are mainly grass and fodder. The higher ground is used as rough pasture for sheep grazing and hill cattle. As the ground becomes higher, some of the rough moorland has been planted with young trees. The damp peaty soil of some of the moorland encourages bird and plant life. Apart from derelict spaces of the old miners rows and railway station, the village itself consists of some council houses, a few private houses, a hall a public house and a school. A mobile welding company, a glazier, a plant hire, and a local coach hire business have bases in Douglas Water.
